Slurm

System Management

Comprehensive HPC workload management with job submission, monitoring, and resource allocation. Provides complete Slurm workload manager functionality through the Model Context Protocol.

1.0.0 Version
12 Actions
Jul 19 Updated
Python Language

Installation Methods

Quick Start

cd /path/to/scientific-mcps/Slurm uv sync && uv run slurm-mcp

UV Package Manager

uv sync uv run slurm-mcp

Traditional pip

pip install -e . python -m src.server

Direct Execution

uv run slurm-mcp

Claude Desktop

{ "mcpServers": { "slurm-mcp": { "command": "uv", "args": [ "--directory", "/path/to/scientific-mcps/Slurm", "run", "slurm-mcp" ] } } }

WARP Client

MCP: - Slurm python3 bin/wrp.py --conf=bin/confs/Gemini.yaml

Claude CLI

claude add mcp slurm -- uv --directory ~/path/to/scientific-mcps/Slurm run slurm-mcp

Available Actions

  • submit_slurm_job
    Submit a job to the Slurm queue with comprehensive job parameters
    Parameters: job_script, job_name, nodes, tasks, time_limit, partition, memory, output_file
  • check_job_status
    Check detailed status of specific jobs or all user jobs
    Parameters: job_id (optional), user (optional)
  • cancel_slurm_job
    Cancel running or pending jobs with optional signal specification
    Parameters: job_id, signal (optional)
  • list_jobs
    List all jobs with filtering options by user, state, or partition
    Parameters: user (optional), state (optional), partition (optional)
  • get_job_details
    Get comprehensive job details including resource usage and timing
    Parameters: job_id
  • get_slurm_info
    Get general Slurm cluster information and configuration
    Parameters: None
  • get_queue_info
    Get detailed partition and queue information
    Parameters: partition (optional)
  • get_node_info
    Get information about cluster nodes and their states
    Parameters: node_name (optional)
  • estimate_job_start
    Estimate when a pending job will start execution
    Parameters: job_id
  • get_job_efficiency
    Calculate job efficiency metrics for completed jobs
    Parameters: job_id
  • get_accounting_info
    Get accounting information for jobs and resource usage
    Parameters: job_id (optional), user (optional), start_time (optional)
  • sacct_query
    Execute custom sacct queries for detailed job accounting
    Parameters: query_options

Usage Examples

Job Submission

submit_slurm_job(script_path="my_job.sh", cores=4, memory="8GB") submit_slurm_job( script_path="simulation.sh", cores=16, memory="32GB", time_limit="02:00:00", partition="compute" ) submit_slurm_job( script_path="analysis.py", cores=8, memory="16GB", job_name="data_analysis" )

Job Monitoring

check_job_status(job_id="12345") check_job_status(job_id="67890")

Job Management

list_slurm_jobs() list_slurm_jobs(user="username", state="RUNNING") list_slurm_jobs(state="PENDING")

Array Jobs

submit_array_job( script_path="parallel_task.sh", array_range="1-100", cores=2, memory="4GB" ) submit_array_job( script_path="parameter_sweep.py", array_range="1-1000:10", cores=4, memory="8GB", time_limit="01:00:00" )

Interactive Sessions

allocate_slurm_nodes(nodes=1, cores=4, memory="8GB", time_limit="02:00:00") allocate_slurm_nodes( nodes=2, cores=8, memory="16GB", partition="interactive" )
